an6.73:1.1: “Mendicants, without giving up these six qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.
an6.73:1.3: Desire for sensual pleasures, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
an6.73:1.4: And the drawbacks of sensual pleasures haven’t been truly seen clearly with right wisdom.
an6.73:1.5: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.
an6.73:2.1: But after giving up these six qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.
an6.73:2.3: Desire for sensual pleasures, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
an6.73:2.4: And the drawbacks of sensual pleasures have been truly seen clearly with right wisdom.
an6.73:2.5: After giving up these six qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.”
